title: Vikings Reportedly Exploring Free Agent Cornerback Lardarius Webb | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3
text:
Vikings Reportedly Exploring Free Agent Cornerback Lardarius Webb posted by Alexander Shun - 
Alexander Shun | @alexpshun 
Digital Content Manager | KFAN.com 
With the departure of nickel cornerback Captain Munnerlyn, the Minnesota Vikings have a hole to fill in their secondary, and they might have found just the cornerback to do so. 
According to Chris Tomasson of the St. Paul Pioneer Press, the Vikings are exploring former Baltimore Ravens defensive back Lardarius Webb. #Vikings exploring free-agent DB Lardarius Webb as potential fit although @JasonLaCanfora has reported he may re-sign with Ravens. â€” Chris Tomasson (@christomasson) March 13, 2017 
Webb, the 31-year old defensive back, would be entering his ninth season and is coming off a season during which he played in all 16 games for the Ravens and racked up 73 combined tackles, one sack, five passes defensed and one interception. Check out Vikings.com for more information and Minnesota Vikings coverage throughout the year! Contact
